summary: Mobile budgeting & payment app (FinMate) with banking-grade security, biometric auth, AI-powered categorization & chatbot, gamification, multi-bank integration, analytics, and 4-page structure (Home, History, Analytics, Profile) with dark/light mode
architectural_notes: Mobile app targeting student users exclusively
AI-powered automatic transaction categorization engine required
Real payment processing integration needed (QR, phone number, scanner)
Bank account linking API integration for balance and transactions
Dual AI chatbot system: general assistance + analytics-focused
Gamification backend for points, challenges, and leaderboard
Purplish-blue theme with PhonePe-style UI patterns
Banking-grade security: biometric auth, AES-256 encryption, JWT, SSL pinning, fraud detection AI, MFA for high-value transfers
Multi-bank Open Banking API integration for real-time balance sync across accounts, credit cards, and debit cards
Dark/light mode theming support required throughout the app
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Budgeting tips ad banner illustration — abstract coins and a piggy bank with a purple-blue gradient background (ad-budgeting.dim_600x200.png)
- Personal loans ad banner illustration — stylized document and currency notes with a blue-indigo gradient background (ad-loans.dim_600x200.png)
- Investments ad banner illustration — upward trending graph with gold coins and a deep-purple gradient background (ad-investments.dim_600x200.png)
- Credit score ad banner illustration — shield icon with a star rating dial and a teal-purple gradient background (ad-credit-score.dim_600x200.png)
- Student savings ad banner illustration — graduation cap with stacked coins and a violet-blue gradient background (ad-student-savings.dim_600x200.png)

existing_features.title: Create user authentication system using Internet Identity for secure student access
Create gamification system with challenges (saving goals), digi points reward mechanism, and leaderboard tracking user rankings based on savings achievements
Build spending limit feature allowing students to set budget caps per category or overall, with alerts when approaching or exceeding limits
Implement transaction history view with filtering by weekly, monthly, and yearly periods, showing date/time, amount, category, and credit/debit indicator
Create analytics dashboard with graphs showing category-wise spending breakdown, income vs expense trends, and time-based analysis (weekly, monthly, yearly)
Integrate bank account display showing current balance similar to PhonePe interface
Implement QR code scanner functionality on home page for payment processing, supporting payment via scanned QR codes or phone numbers
Create AI chatbot interface for general assistance with budgeting queries and financial guidance
Add dedicated AI chatbot in the analytical page to provide insights and explanations about spending patterns and financial data
Implement refer and earn program allowing users to invite friends and earn rewards, with tracking of referral points
Create offers section displaying available deals, discounts, and promotional content relevant to students
Design dashboard with purplish-blue theme featuring home icon, history icon, bank balance display, and scanner icon, following modern mobile app conventions

Investigate and fix visual glitching issues on the login page (frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx), ensuring smooth rendering of the FinMate logo, login button, loading states, and feature highlights without layout shifts, flickering, or animation artifacts
Create a BankLinkingPage component at frontend/src/pages/BankLinkingPage.tsx with a form to input and submit a bank account number
Create a custom hook useSetBankAccount at frontend/src/hooks/useSetBankAccount.ts that wraps the backend setBankAccount function as a React Query mutation
Create a custom hook useGetBankAccount at frontend/src/hooks/useGetBankAccount.ts that fetches the linked bank account number using React Query
Add a route for /bank-linking in frontend/src/App.tsx that renders the BankLinkingPage component
Add a navigation button or link on the ProfilePage (frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx) that directs users to the bank linking page

Add a dark mode / light mode toggle button in the top section of the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) that switches the app-wide theme. Persist the user's preference in localStorage and apply the appropriate Tailwind dark class to the root element.

Enhance the Home page top section (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) to display: a personalized greeting (e.g., 'Good morning, [Name]'), the user's profile avatar/initials, and a notifications bell icon with a badge indicator. These should appear in a structured top bar layout consistent with the purple-blue theme.

Add Quick Actions row on the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) below the Scan & Pay CTA. Actions: 'Recharge', 'Book Train Tickets', and 'Send Money'. Each action should be a tappable icon+label button. 'Recharge' navigates to a recharge flow, 'Send Money' opens the QR/phone payment modal, and 'Book Train Tickets' shows a placeholder 'Coming Soon' toast.

Add a search bar and export functionality to the History page (frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx). The search bar should filter the displayed transaction list in real-time by transaction name/description. Add an 'Export' button that generates and downloads a CSV file of the currently filtered transactions.

Add manual re-categorization to the History page (frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx). Each transaction row should have an edit/category icon that opens a dropdown or modal to select a new category. On confirmation, the transaction's category is updated via a backend mutation.

Expand the transaction category list across the app (backend/main.mo, PaymentForm, History filter, Analytics) to include: Food, Clothes, College Expenses, Travel, Subscriptions, Bills, EMI, Investments, Recharge, and Others (custom). Ensure these categories are consistently used in transaction creation, filtering, and analytics.

Add a Weekly Comparison bar chart and a Financial Health Score widget to the Analytics page (frontend/src/pages/AnalyticsPage.tsx). The weekly comparison chart should show spending totals for the current week vs the previous week by category. The Financial Health Score (0–100) should be computed client-side based on: savings rate, spending limit adherence, and challenge completion rate — displayed as a progress ring with a color-coded label (Poor/Fair/Good/Excellent).

Enhance the AI Analyst section on the Analytics page (frontend/src/pages/AnalyticsPage.tsx / frontend/src/components/AnalyticsChatbot.tsx) to proactively display AI-generated insight cards (not just chat). On page load, auto-generate 3–4 insight cards using the analyticsInsights utility covering: top overspending category, subscription waste detection, savings suggestion, and a comparison to last month. Cards should appear above the chatbot interface.

Enhance the Profile page (frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx) to display: user's email (from Internet Identity / profile), phone number (editable field saved to profile), profile avatar with initials, linked bank accounts section showing account number (masked), and a Subscription Plan section showing a 'Free Plan' badge with an 'Upgrade' CTA placeholder.

Add a Notifications settings section to the Profile page (frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx) with toggle switches for: 'Spending limit alerts', 'Challenge reminders', 'Weekly summary', and 'Offer notifications'. Persist notification preferences in the backend user profile.

Add an auto-logout mechanism to the frontend that logs the user out after 5 minutes of inactivity (no mouse movement, clicks, or key presses). Show a 60-second countdown warning modal before logging out. Reset the inactivity timer on any user interaction. On logout, clear the session and redirect to the login page.

Remove the BankBalanceCard component from the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx). In its place, render a horizontally scrollable promotional ads/banners carousel with cards covering topics such as Budgeting Tips, Personal Loans, Mutual Fund Investments, Credit Score Improvement, and Student Savings Plans. Each ad card should display a title, a short description, a relevant icon or illustration, a CTA button label (e.g., 'Learn More', 'Apply Now'), and use the existing purple-blue theme with gradient backgrounds. The carousel should auto-scroll every 4 seconds and support manual swipe/click navigation with dot indicators.

Add a 'Check Balance' button on the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) that, when tapped, opens a PIN verification modal. The modal should display a 6-digit PIN input (masked). On correct PIN entry (validate against a PIN stored in localStorage or the backend user profile), reveal the bank balance in a compact card overlay or inline section. After 3 consecutive incorrect PIN attempts, lock the modal for 30 seconds and show an error message. The backend should expose a function to store and verify the PIN hash, or use a localStorage-based PIN for client-side verification as a fallback.

Add a Spending Limits summary section on the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx), placed below the promotional ads carousel. Fetch the user's spending limits via the existing useSpendingLimits hook and the current month's debit transactions via useTransactions. For each category that has a limit set, display a compact row showing: category name, a progress bar (current spend / limit), and the amount spent vs. the limit. Rows that exceed 80% of the limit should display an amber warning indicator; rows exceeding 100% should display a red over-budget indicator. Show a maximum of 4 categories with a 'View All' link that navigates to the SpendingLimitsPage.

Add a Challenges & Leaderboard preview section on the Home page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx), placed below the Spending Limits section. Fetch challenges via the existing useChallenges hook and leaderboard via useLeaderboard. Display up to 2 active (incomplete) challenges as compact cards showing: challenge title, progress indicator, and a 'Complete' button that calls the useCompleteChallenge mutation. Below the challenges, show a mini leaderboard table with the top 3 users (rank, name/principal truncated, digi points). Include a 'View All' link that navigates to the ChallengesPage for both sections.

new_feature_requests.summary: Gamification system with leaderboard, challenges, and digi points for saving goals
Spending limit setting and tracking expenses with automatic AI categorization
Expense categories: grocery, hostel, food, travel, personal, clothing, mobile recharge, and custom options
Transaction history with date/time, credit/debit indicator, filterable by weekly/monthly/yearly
Category-wise analysis with graphs and automatic income/expense analysis
Bank account linking with security features and balance display like PhonePe
Payment functionality: QR code scanner, phone number transfer, actual payment processing
AI chatbot for general assistance and another AI chatbot in analytical page
Refer and earn program with offers section
Dashboard with purplish-blue theme, home icon, history, bank balance, and scanner icon on home page
Implement backend data model for user profiles storing student information, digi points balance, spending limits, and linked bank account status

Create transaction data model with fields for amount, type (credit/debit), category (grocery, hostel expense, food, travel, personal, clothing, mobile recharge, and custom categories), timestamp, description, and payment method
Implement AI-powered transaction categorization that automatically assigns categories to transactions based on description and amount patterns
Add mobile recharge category as a transaction type with dedicated UI for initiating recharge payments
Add a bank account number field to the UserProfile type in backend/main.mo to store the linked bank account number as optional Text
Create a backend function setBankAccount that accepts a bank account number as Text and updates the caller's profile with this account number
Create a backend query function getBankAccount that returns the caller's linked bank account number if set, otherwise returns null
Splash screen with biometric authentication (fingerprint/Face ID), 6-digit PIN fallback, 3-failed-attempts lockout, and optional device binding + OTP

Banking-grade security: AES-256 encryption, SSL pinning, JWT auth, auto logout on inactivity, root/jailbreak detection, fraud detection AI, transaction anomaly detection, encrypted local storage, MFA for high-value transfers
Dark mode / light mode toggle accessible from home page top section
Home page top section: greeting, profile image, notifications bell, and check balance for all linked accounts
Quick actions on home page: Recharge, Book Train Tickets, Send Money below the Scan & Pay CTA
Multi-bank account linking supporting multiple bank accounts, credit cards, debit cards with real-time sync via Open Banking API
Transaction history: search, export as PDF/CSV, bulk categorize, manual re-categorization, filter by bank account; expanded categories including Subscriptions, Bills, EMI, Investments
Analytics page: category-wise pie chart, monthly bar graph, weekly comparison graph, income vs expense line graph, per-category graphs, overall financial health score
AI Analyst in analytics page: overspending alerts, savings suggestions, investment suggestions, subscription waste detection, personalized budget plan
Profile page: profile image, name, email, phone, check balance, linked bank accounts management, credit/debit cards, refer & earn DigiPoints, notifications, subscription plan, log out
Remove bank balance display from home page; replace with promotional ads/banners related to budgeting, loans, and investments
Bank balance check requires PIN verification before displaying balance
Show spending limits per category on the home page with progress indicators
Show gamification challenges and leaderboard on the home page
